channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Palace responds to medical frontliners' call for ECQ in Mega Manila
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: Roque only said that the comments will be accepted but did not directly state if Mega Manila will be placed under ECQ as recommended.

item.title: Medical frontliners advise return to ECQ in Mega Manila until August 15
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: "The medical community appeals for a return to enhanced community quarantine in Mega Manila from August 1 to 15 to recalibrate strategies against COVID-19."

item.title: Telcos blame LGUs for slow tower rollout
item.author: Richmond Mercurio

item.title: Philippines COVID-19 cases hit 90,000, surpassing China
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Philippines has overtaken China in the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases, data from the Department of Health and World Health Organization showed yesterday.?

item.title: House probe on PhilHealth scam sought
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Militant lawmakers yesterday pushed for a congressional investigation on the Interim Reimbursement Mechanism of the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. , which was identified as the source of corruption in the agency.

item.title: 20 million poorest Pinoys to get free COVID-19 vaccine
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte unveiled yesterday a P20-billion plan to provide free vaccines for at least 20 million poor Filipinos who would be prioritized once the vaccine becomes available, he hopes by yearend, even as he chided critics who claim that his administration has no credible roadmap to address the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: NCR still under GCQ; quarantine eased in Cebu
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: After strengthening their healthcare capacity and strictly enforcing health standards and quarantine rules, the cities of Cebu, Mandaue and Lapu Lapu – all in Cebu province – will be under general community quarantine beginning today, from the stricter modified enhanced community quarantine in the last two weeks.

item.title: DOF chief: Economy on way to recovery
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The Philippine economy is beginning to recover, with prices of goods “relatively low” and the peso emerging as Asia’s strongest, Finance Secretary Carlos Dominguez III said yesterday.

item.title: Faculty training for online education to start
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde will hold a five-day training program next week to prepare college educators to adjust to an online learning environment for the upcoming school year.

item.title: IATF wants COVID-19 bed capacity increased in hospitals
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The government has ordered private and public hospitals to increase the number of beds allocated for coronavirus patients as the number of cases continued to increase in recent weeks, reaching more than 85,000 by the end of July.
